titlStmt.titl: Evaluation of an Online Peer Support Network for Parents of Children with a Heart or Liver Transplant

citation.biblCit: West, Lori; Nicholas, David; Dodd, Bernadette; Gilmour, Susan; Urschel, Simon; Yap, Jason; McClure, Michelle; Roberts, Cheri, 2016, "Evaluation of an Online Peer Support Network for Parents of Children with a Heart or Liver Transplant", https://doi.org/10.7939/DVN/10922, UAL Dataverse, V1

titlStmt.titl: Evaluation of an Online Peer Support Network for Parents of Children with a Heart or Liver Transplant

stdyInfo.abstract: This study will initiate and evaluate a 6 month online peer support network for parents of a child with a heart (HTx) or liver transplant (LTx). Specifically, study objectives comprise exploration of: (1) the effectiveness of an online network for caregiving parents of children with HTx or LTx; (2) parents' experiences and perceptions of the network; (3) the benefits/limitations of online technology for peer interaction; and (4) the means by which parents convey support within this online context.

sumDscr.dataKind: Interview data; Focus group data; Survey data; Qualitative data; Clinical data
sumDscr.universe: Parents of children with a heart or liver transplant.

dataColl.frequenc: Data was collected at baseline, weekly during the duration of the group, and at 6 months.
dataColl.sampProc: Approximately 50 parents were recruited to the study; 24 parents actively participated in the study.

sources.dataSrc: The Multidimensional Support Scale (DSS); Meaning of Illness Questionnaire (MIQ); Coping Health Inventory for Parents;

dataColl.collMode: Face-to-face interview; Telephone interview; Recording; Network transcript review
dataColl.collSitu: An analysis of the content of the entire network was conducted. Both quantitative analysis (e.g., patterns and volume of involvement per participant, number of posts, questions, replies, etc.) and qualitative-based information were analyzed from verbatim transcripts of network dialogue. An interview guide was used in post-study interviews.

useStmt.restrctn: Data collected will not become part of a data repository or be involved in the creation of a research database at a future date.
useStmt.conditions: Access to the data is limited to selected members of the research team.
